fields.description: The service desk widget only displays a small version of KB articles. It would be great to have a button that redirects to the article in the portal so customers can view full-page articles.
fields.summary: Jira Service Desk Widget have an icon which can be pressed to view full article in portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Customers cannot see/open attachments (images) added to the description of customer tickets by agents (from Jira or from the portal) - 403 forbidden. This occurs when the attachment is added inline in the description content.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As a customer, raise a ticket
# As an agent, upload an image to the description field

Other flow:
# As an agent create a request on behalf of someone within Jira and upload an attachment on the create issue screen
# Add to the description of the create issue screen
# Using automation or manually set a request type
# As a customer attempt to open the attachment in the portal
# You receive a 403 forbidden

h3. Expected Results

* As an agent I can see the image in the ticket description
* As a customer I can see the image in the ticket description

h3. Actual Results
* As a customer, the image does NOT get displayed (403 on the network fetching the image)
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
Add the attachment in a comment, not to the description during creation
fields.summary: Attachments/images added by agents to the description of a customer portal ticket (raised by them or on behalf of them) don't get displayed when logged in as a customer

fields.description:
*Summary*
Customers in an Organization can't add themselves as request participants with restricted Customer Permissions

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Go to the project's Customer Permissions and set *Who can customers share requests with?* to either
#* "Other customers in their organization. This option only allows them to search for customers in their organization."; or
#* "Any customer in the project, by manually entering an email address."
# Have an organization with Customer A and B in it;
# Create a ticket with Customer A as reporter, shared with that Org
# Logged in as Customer B, on the portal, try to share that ticket with yourself (to add as request participant)

*Expected Results*
User is added as request participant

*Actual Results*
User cannot be found. Searching for yourself will only work with the "Any customer or organization, by searching this project. This option allows them to search all customers in the current project." option selected on the Customer Permission settings.

*Workaround*
Change Customer Permission.
fields.summary: Customers in an Organization can't add themselves as request participants with restricted Customer Permissions

fields.description:
Currently, we have the audit log on automation, but it only shows if it was successful or not.
It would be great if we could see on Audit log what changes were made and who made the change.
fields.summary: Audit log should register changes made on Automation rules

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Changes in the Service Desk configuration does not log an entry into the audit logs causing admins to not know who and what changes were done.
* Customers added/Removed to a JSM Project.
* Organizations added/Removed to a JSM project.

h3. Suggested solution
Include the changes into audit logs by recording who and what is changed
h3. Why is it important
The information would allow more transparency towards the changes in configuration.
fields.summary: Include Service Desk configuration changes to audit logs

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Sometimes customers prefer to manage customers and organizations on a CSV file, but there is no way to export this information from Jira.

h3. Suggested resolution

Create a way to export the organization customers per project.

h3. Workaround

Raise a support ticket [here|https://support.atlassian.com] mentioning this suggestion
fields.summary: Ability to export organization members per project
Allow adding a different banner to each portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Reports of SLAs which have the same name as a Jira system field (priority, resolution, assignee etc) will display no results.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an SLA that has the same name as a Jira system field. For example, "Assignee".
 # Configure it with a very straight forward setting, such as the one below.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
 # Create and resolve a few tickets
 # Create any of the SLA custom reports (Met, Breached, % - Met)

h3. Expected Results

The SLA report displays the information from the resolved tickets.
h3. Actual Results

The report shows 0 issues.
h3. Workaround

There is a workaround for this issue that would require using custom ids of the SLA fields.
 # Find the custom id of the SLA field (for e.g. cf[100049] in the below screenshot, where other 'assignee' is the system field)
 !sla-custom-id.png|thumbnail!
 # Use this field in the SLA report's series, combining with the SLA JQL functions
 !report-series.png|thumbnail!   !report-series-filter.png|thumbnail!

For e.g. To replicate *Assignee - breached* use {color:#ff8b00}*{{cf[10049] = breached()}}*{color}

_Note: the above screenshots are from different projects hence the custom ids are shown different. They should be same across screens for any project._
fields.summary: SLA Reports shows 'no issues' if the SLAs has the same name as a Jira system field

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Sometimes customers have different support channels, like phone or chat, but Jira only shows portal, Jira or email.

h3. Suggested resolution

Add the ability to add more channel options to the channel field.
fields.summary: Ability to add more channels to Jira Service Desk

fields.description:
When you delete a comment that was the origin of an attachment, the file will be deleted from the attachments if the comment was submitted through the customer portal or sent via email. In case the comment was sent through Jira, deleting it won't result in the deletion of the attachment.

 

*Suggestion*

Add a checkbox to the 'Delete Comment screen' in Jira that lets you decide if the attachment should also be deleted.
fields.summary: Ability to choose whether deleting an attachment or not when deleting the comment that originated it

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Sometimes customers don't want to pay for an agent license to have a user to configure the specific Service Desk configurations like request types, customer permissions, and others.

h3. Suggested resolution

Create a permission to have non-agents users Service Desk specific administrative permission.
fields.summary: Service Desk specific administrative permissions to non-agents users

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The JSD reporting dashboard says on it's description you can display custom and knowledge base reports but only custom reports can be selected.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add JSD reporting gadget to dashboard
# Notice you can only choose custom reports

h3. Expected Results
The knowledge base reports are available as well as mentioned in the description of the gadget.

h3. Actual Results
You can only select custom reports
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
No known workaround
fields.summary: JSD reporting gadget unable to choose knowledge base reports

fields.description:
Sometimes when issue collector is embedded on a website and it fails to create an issue due to local cache issues, it gives a misleading error message as below

 !Screen Shot 2019-03-26 at 10.02.47 AM.png|thumbnail! 

Clearing cache resolves the issue. However, the error message doesn't suggest so and needs to be rephrased to something more clear.
fields.summary: Incorrect error message when issue collector fails

fields.description:
Customers are setting up automation rules that when they happen it does not trigger a push notification.
For example if an automation rule sets the assignee of a JSD ticket and if that user has the mobile app then he/she will not receive a push.
fields.summary: JSD Automation rules are not sending push notifications to customers

fields.description:
*Summary*
Users with no Browse Project permission entering JSD onboarding throw Internal Error 500

*Steps to Reproduce*
* Create a new user with Jira Service Desk license (can be site-admin);
* User has no Browse Project permission in any JSD projects;

*Expected Results*
* When the user log in, they should not be redirected to the Onboarding, as they do not have any access to JSD projects


*Actual Results*
* They are redirected to the onboarding, but since they do not have access to a project, the error is shown.

*Workaround*
*Add the user to a project role with Browse Projects permission in a Service Desk project*
fields.summary: Users with no Browse Project permission entering JSD onboarding throw Internal Error 500

fields.description:
h3. Problem
In case the customer has a lot of request types in different projects, they will have to manually change the request type logos one by one.

h3. Suggested Resolution
Create the ability to bulk update the request type logos by grouping them.
fields.summary: Bulk change request type logos

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It is currently not possible to mention users in the customer portal. Although \[~username] displays the user as mentioned, but it does not notify the intended user.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability for customers to mention users in the customer portal
h3. Why this is important
This ability would allow customers reaching the intended users and would allow faster communication
fields.summary: Support mentions in Customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a request is created via email, the original TO, CC and FROM information is scattered into different fields and if any of the fields are updated, the only way to track them is through the issue history
h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to include TO, CC and FROM information into the Description field automatically
fields.summary: Ability to include TO, CC and FROM information into the Description field when request created via email

fields.description: See details in https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/JSDECO-124
fields.summary: Proforma add-on forms not showing on JSD Cloud customer portal forms

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When updating (editing and saving) an SLA that contains complex JQL query goals from a project with a large number of tickets (e.g. ~2k+) will break the SLA on the queues.

h3. Environment

SLAs with complex JQL queries;
Project with ~2k tickets or more.

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Create a project with ~2k tickets or more;
# Create an SLA with complex JQL query goals;
# Create a queue to display the SLA;
# Edit and Save the SLA;
# Check the queue.

h3. Expected results

Jira recalculates the tickets that have the SLA running.

h3. Actual result

The SLA shows broken in the queue view and is not shown on the ticket.
 !Screen Shot 2019-03-21 at 11.49.18.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

* Use this article [Missing or corrupted SLA data in Jira Service Desk|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/missing-or-corrupted-sla-data-in-jira-service-desk-828790603.html] to temporarily fix the issue.
fields.summary: Broken SLAs due to large number of tickets

fields.description: Marie Godin-Bourgeois needs her Email password reset.
fields.summary: Email password reset

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Queue does not show issues when using JQL assignee = "Full name".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new queue on a JSD project.
# On "Issue to show" add the JQL status = Open AND assignee = "Full name".
# The JQL will show as it's working and the issues will appear on the list.
# Save the new queue.

h3. Expected Results

After saving the queue, it will show all the tickets assigned.

h3. Actual Results

The queue shows as empty and when we click to edit the queue it shows the assignee as "unknown".

h3.Workaround
When typing the users' name, click on the options to select the user, so instead of using the full name, use the username.
fields.summary: Queue does not show issues when using JQL assignee = "Full name" or "Email address"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The automation rule condition (If these match...) for User Type is limited to Customer, Not a customer, Agent and Not an agent
h3. Suggested Solution
To allow more flexibility, introduce the ability to use organization member as the User Type too
fields.summary: Ability to add Organization as one of the User Type for automation condition

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
It is not possible to set a portal-only customer as the reporter while creating a request in iOS app.
h3. Environment
* iOS

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue in iOS app.
# Search for a portal-only customer to set as the Reporter

h3. Expected Results
Portal-only customer is listed upon search
h3. Actual Results
The Reporter field shows as searching without giving any results
 
h3. Workaround
Set the reporter in Browser app instead of the Jira iOS app
fields.summary: Adding customers as reporter on iOS app does not work

fields.description: Sue Stevens as well continues to have conflicts with her email migration from Club Auto to the new Xperigo email.
fields.summary: Email

fields.description: Rebecca White is still having issues with email and Club auto email account. She does not always get email that are sent to her.
fields.summary: Email

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Agents could only add existing customers as request participants to a request. To add a non-existing user, the agent would need to invite the user to the project first.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability for agents to add Request Participants without adding them to the project first.
h3. Workaround
It is possible to add non-servicedesk-customers as Request Participants to a request by sharing the ticket with them through the portal. This only applies for projects which allows sign up.
fields.summary: Ability for agents to add non-servicedesk-customers as Request Participant on agent view

fields.description:
h3.Summary

When the browse project permission of a project is set to include 'Service Desk Customer - Portal Access', currently users with JSW application access (but have no access to the project due to not being a JSD customer) , is able to see tickets, boards, projects  and filters of the said project.  They do not have access to the project in question when clicking on the boards and projects but they  are still able to see the projects and issues from suggestions.

h3.Investigation Done

Browse project permission set to include 'Service Desk Customer - Portal Access'
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

No additional groups besides application access group for user
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

User is still able to see the project (AT1) being suggested despite not having access to it.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Steps to Replicate

Refer to the investigation steps above. 

h3.Expected Results

No projects, dashboard, filters or tickets should be return as suggestion

h3.Current Results

Projects with Browse Project permission that includes  'Service Desk Customer - Portal Access'  will return itself, tickets and dashboards under it as suggestion despite the user having no access to it. 

*Note* : Can also potentially be due to side bar result caching with the creation of CONFCLOUD-65887 but have no way of verifying on our end.
fields.summary: 'Service Desk Customer - Portal Access' in Browse Project permission causes side bar to display search suggestions to users with no access to said suggestions

fields.description:
h1. Steps to reproduce

1. Log in as a Collaborator user (eg: a user with the 'Team' project role for a JSD project, but no access to the JSD application role)
 2. In a new tab goto [<instance.url>/rest/api/3/mypermissions|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/#api-rest-api-3-mypermissions-get]
 3. in a new tab goto [<instance.url>/rest/api/latest/mypermissions|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/#api-rest-api-3-mypermissions-get]
h1. Expected result

The response should be identical.
h1. Actual results

Version '3' of the REST API results in fewer permissions than 'latest'. 'latest' behaves identically to version '2'.
h1. Workaround

Use version 2 or latest.
fields.summary: Requesting `mypermissions` via v3 of public Cloud REST API does not give the same result as 'latest' for Service Desk non agent users

fields.description:
h1. Steps to reproduce
1. Log in as {{brian.nguyen+customer@atl-paid-dev.com}}
2. In a different browser invite {{brian.nguyen+customer2@atl-paid-dev.com}} to a service desk
3. In the first browser, goto the sign up link provided in the email
4. Provide a username and password
5. Navigate to the tenant's audit log: {{<tenant_url>/auditing/view}}

h1. Expected result
Audit log renders the password change:
* by {{brian.nguyen+customer2@atl-paid-dev.com}}
* for {{brian.nguyen+customer2@atl-paid-dev.com}}

h1. Actual results
Audit log will render the password change as if {{brian.nguyen+customer@atl-paid-dev.com}} changed the password for {{brian.nguyen+customer2@atl-paid-dev.com}}'s account, causing confusing by making it look like a customer account could override some other customer account's password.
 !audit-log-symptom.png|thumbnail! 

h1. Workaround
None.

h1. Notes
Additionally:
* this might affect other flows like portal signup / reset password. Let's make sure we consider them when fixing too
* consider adding an entry in the audit log when the invite is sent out if possible
fields.summary: When setting a customer account's password, the potentially different&existing logged in user/session will be used in audit log to record the password change, causing confusion and making it look like a password hijack

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Jira service desk rest api call for customers does not respect pagination when the results returned are more than 50. It always forces the results to a limit and size of 50.
https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/servicedeskapi/servicedesk/<projeci_id>/customer?start=0&limit=100&size=100

h3. Environment
Jira service desk

h3. Steps to Reproduce
#  Create a service desk project with more than 50 Customers 
# runt the rest api call https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/servicedeskapi/servicedesk/<projeci_id>/customer?start=0&limit=100&size=100

h3. Expected Results
Results returned with a limit of 100 and a size of 100

h3. Actual Results
Results returned with a limit of 50 and size of 50 ignoring that set parameters

h3. Workaround
Use the "start" parameter to get the next batch of 50.
So for Example, first time run the code below to get first 50:
{code}https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/servicedeskapi/servicedesk/<projeci_id>/customer?start=0&limit=50&size=50
{code}
The second time run the code  below to get 51 to 100
{code}https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/servicedeskapi/servicedesk/<projeci_id>/customer?start=51&limit=50&size=50
{code}
fields.summary: REST Api call for customers does not respect pagination (limit, size)

fields.description:
We are looking for an add-on or solution, to track our time by components, issue type and project. Furthermore, we want to filter by these sections and export the data to create reports.

Are there any solutions?

kind regards.
fields.summary: TimeTracking - tracking and filter by components, issue type or project

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The customer notification email templates does not apply to the customer invite 'account' notification type.

In the UI it states it will not effect 'account' type notifications:
_Templates change the look and style of request-related and custom notifications. You can add logos and variables, change the subject line, and more._

h3. Suggested Solution
Include the email template for customer invites so a footer with the company logo and details can be included giving it a more professional look.

h3. Workaround
No known workaround.
fields.summary: Apply the email template to customer invite 'account' type notifications

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a customer is invited, only the agent who invited the customer would be aware that a customer was invited and has access to a project
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow admins to be alerted when a customer is invited to a project
h3. Why this is important
As agents can invite any email address to a project, agents might mistakenly invite unwanted users. For security purposes, admins needs to audit who is invited to a portal to avoid unwanted information breached and an alert would allow admins to take actions immediately.
fields.summary: Alert admins when a customer is invited to a project

fields.description:
The use case is: 
 # We want to send emails to our customers outside of JSD (eg because we can CC and BCC, and have more control over branding, and use our favourite email client, it is not possible send anonymously in Jira [it always puts the agent's name in the From field] etc, etc)
 # We want to record those conversations in the relevant Jira ticket.
 # We don't want to have to copy-paste those emails into the ticket, if we can instead just CC the relevant JSD email for this project.
 # But we also don't want the customer to get a second copy of this email, just because we CCed Jira in the mail we sent to them.

Right now there is not enough control over emails sent by JSD to customer users, and this results in having to use a traditional email client outside of JSD, CCing mails into the JSD project email address, and a duplicate of that mail being sent to the customer.

One way to address this is to prevent mails into a JSD request sent by a JSD agent (licensed user) being sent on to the customer (or improve the email capability within JSD to allow: CC, BCC, anonymous sending), or whatever else is required to make this possible.
fields.summary: Stop emails from JSD agents into JSD being sent to customers

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a select list is positioned at the bottom of a page, the select list does not "drop-down" but instead, it "drop-up" to allow the field to be viewable without scrolling
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow disabling the select list field from displaying the values to "drop-up"
h3. Why this is important
This behaviour could be confusing for people working into the business sector
fields.summary: Allow disabling select list field to "drop-up"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* Currently there isn't a way to assign permissions to specific "Organizations"
* In reference to Knowledge Base(KB) articles, it's not possible to create bespoke documentation per customer
* Customers are unable to customize the end user's experience - similar to [JSDCLOUD-4486| https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4486]

h3. Suggested Solution
* Allow "Organizations" to be included in permissions schemes(for Confluence also)
* Create a group that is assigned to Organization members

h3. Why this is important
* Allows customers to provide a more tailored service desk for their customers
 
h3. Workaround 
* [Migrate the customer accounts|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-jira-service-desk-customer-accounts-913213935.html] to an Atlassian account that doesn't have any licenses assigned to that account and then use "Groups" to restrict the KB articles based on group membership
fields.summary: Knowledge Base: Allow page restrictions to be assigned based on "Organizations" - similar to user groups

fields.description:
Currently, only one customer request type can be mapped to the email address for a service desk, allowing only one type of issue to be created via email.

However, tags could be used to create different request types without the need to create multiple email addresses for a service desk.

*Example*:

Suppose a service desk email address is    [mysd@mycompany.atlassian.net|mailto:mysd@mycompany.atlassian.net]

And this service desk has 2 request types: "Bug Report" and "User Administration Request".

If the tags "bug" and "useradmin" could be mapped to the request types above, then an email to [mysd+bug@mycompany.atlassian.net|mailto:mysd+bug@mycompany.atlassian.net]  would create a request of type "Bug Report" whereas an email to [mysd+useradmin@mycompany.atlassian.net|mailto:mysd+useradmin@mycompany.atlassian.net]  would create a request type of "User Administration Request".

Note that no new email addresses are actually being created. The only email address here is still [mysd@mycompany.atlassian.net|mailto:mysd@mycompany.atlassian.net] .

Also note that if no tag is given, a default request type will be used.
fields.summary: Allow email tags to be mapped to customer request types

fields.description:
*Suggestion*:

Display the collapsible Portfolio hierarchy (and especially the "Progress" indicator) on the Service Desk customer portal if the Service Desk issue originally created by the customer is also a Portfolio initiative. It should also be possible to mark some tickets in the hierarchy as "Internal", and these would be excluded from the hierarchy display on the customer portal.

*Background*:

Some customer requests via the service desk are like Portfolio initiatives to us because we break them down by department, then let each department create their Epics and tasks/stories under the Epic. This allows us to maintain the breakdown in Portfolio, where it is quite convenient to see the progress at various levels.

However, the customer only sees the ticket they created and not the rest of the hierarchy through the customer portal.
fields.summary: Display portfolio hierarchy in customer portal

fields.description:
We want to migrate project from one jira cloud account to another jira cloud account

This is Very High Priority one
fields.summary: we want to migrate project from one jira cloud account to another jira cloud account

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The "Request resolved" notification is sent to all requests which are resolved with a valid resolution value. In some cases, the notification is not required to allow notifications not sent for requests which are Cancelled, for example.
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow conditional "Request resolved" notification
fields.summary: Allow conditional "Request resolved" notification

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When uploading attachments through the Customer Portal you may receive an *Upload Failed* message. This is due to the Authorisation Token expiring, after 20 minutes of inactivity.

h3. Screenshot
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Improvements
Add a meaningful message to the portal mentioning that the session has expired.

h3. Workaround
Refresh the portal before uploading attachment
fields.summary: Improve Upload failed message when session expires in Customer Portal.

fields.description: Under "Feature an article" on the  [Write and Share Articles|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/write-and-share-articles-957150226.html] page about the Confluence knowledge base integration with Jira Service Desk, Step 1 is blank/missing.
fields.summary: Missing step in the "Feature an Article" section of KB page

fields.description:
When a portal-only customer replies to a customer notification with "Reply all" or manually add the Default Cloud Mail Server (jira@<instance>.atlassian.net) to the recipients, the message will be only added as a comment to the ticket if the Cloud email address (configured in the project to receive email requests) comes first in the 'To:' email field.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Add a Forward Email to the properties of "Comments from emails" email handler:
 !print.png|thumbnail!
 # Customer (portal-only) sends a request via email;
 # Customer selects "Reply all" (or manually add the Default Cloud Mail Server to the recipients) to a customer notification

h3. Expected results

The reply is added as a comment anyway.
h3. Actual result

When a reply is sent with the "To:" field having the recipients in the order:
 *To:* {{<projectkey>@<instancename>.atlassian.net, jira@<instancename>.atlassian.net}}
 * Result: Reply is added to the ticket as a comment.

When a reply is sent with the "To:" field having the recipients in the order:
 *To:* {{jira@<instancename>.atlassian.net, <projectkey>@<instancename>.atlassian.net}}
 * Result: Comment is not created and below error message is sent to the Forward Email.

{quote}_{color:#172b4d}This is an automated email from the issue creation service at "https://<instance>.atlassian.net".{color}_

_{color:#172b4d}An error was encountered whilst handling messages from the mail server{color}_
_{color:#172b4d}"POP Mail Server" using the handler "class com.atlassian.studio.jira.service.util.handler.StudioEmailHandler".{color}_

_{color:#172b4d}The error was:{color}_
_{color:#172b4d}------------------------{color}_
_{color:#172b4d}"User '<name>' does not have permission to comment on an issue in project '<project_id>'.{color}_
_{color:#172b4d}"{color}_
_{color:#172b4d}------------------------{color}_

_{color:#172b4d}The error and the email that caused the error are attached to this email.{color}_

_{color:#172b4d}If this is a recurring problem, you may wish to contact a system administrator to check the parameters of your mail fetching service:{color}_

_{color:#172b4d}–{color}_
_{color:#172b4d}This message was sent by Atlassian Jira{color}_
_{color:#172b4d}(v${build.version}#${build.currentBuildNumber}){color}_
{quote}
 
h3. Notes

To prevent this from happening, customers must simply reply to customer notifications, having in the recipients only the email address set in the project for email requests.
fields.summary: Unable to comment on ticket via email if the default mail server  is in the "To:" field

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When the instance only has one Service Desk project, consequently one portal, Jira will show "duplicate" information about the request type.
 !Recentlyusedforms.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Resolution
Have the ability to remove or hide the "Recently used forms" section when only using one Service Desk project and portal.
fields.summary: Ability to remove/hide the "Recently used forms" from portal
Adding comment with jsdPublic set to false does not hide comment in Service Desk projects

fields.description:
I want to put client's issues (email requests), on specific queue. 

Is it possible to use client's email domain (eg @domain.com) to define organisation?

We receive emails from employees and 3rd that work on/to same company, and we want to put all requests from these people on same queue.
fields.summary: use customer domain in organisation

fields.description:
*Summary*
Collaborators can't link Software issues with Service Desk tickets on the New Issue View

*Steps to Reproduce*
Have collaborator with Agent permissions, but no JSD license. Try linking a Software issue to A SD ticket.

*Expected Results*
The issues will be linked.

*Actual Results*
It'll throw an error 401 on the new issue view, but will be linked on the old issue view.

*Workaround*
Use the old issue view
fields.summary: Collaborators can't link Software issues with Service Desk tickets on the New Issue View

fields.description:
Currently, we add the base HTML tag in Service Desk customer notifications. Example:

{code}
<base href="https://instance.atlassian.net">
{code}

This tag is known to be exploited, especially for Office 365 email servers:

 - https://thehackernews.com/2018/05/microsoft-safelinks-phishing.html
 - https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/office-365-zero-day-used-in-real-world-phishing-campaigns/

Because of this, a lot of administrators and phishing/scam filters rejects (or silently rejects) the messages, making the troubleshooting of this problem hard and needing to frequently involve multiple departments. 

The tag should be removed and the URL's added dynamically in the links of the template.
fields.summary: Service Desk notifications shouldn't be using the HTML base tag

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Statement*
Timed event Automations rules does not run when "Run Rules As: User who triggered the rule" option are set and following error are displayed:
 !Screenshot 2019-03-08 at 9.52.35 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. *Steps to Replicate*
# Create a new Service Desk Automation Rules
# Options > Run Rules As: User who triggered the rule: 
!Screenshot 2019-03-08 at 9.07.25 AM.png|thumbnail! 
# Add a trigger for "When this happens...": Time in Status and specify a status for any amount for an amount of time.
eg.    !Screenshot 2019-03-08 at 10.01.09 AM.png|thumbnail! 
# Add an Action

h3. *Expected Result*
The delayed-timed event Automation runs and system able to capture who executed the timed event actions. 

h3. *Actual Result*
Delayed Automation doesn't execute with the error on the log rules:
 !Screenshot 2019-03-08 at 10.02.52 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. *Workaround*
Run Rules as Project Default
 !Screenshot 2019-03-08 at 10.04.08 AM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: User who triggered the rule for time event Automation rule doesn't identify the correct user

fields.description: This feature request has been created in order to get feedback on the new JSD issue view redesign.
fields.summary: Feedback on the new JSD Issue View design

fields.description:
h3. Summary

* Screens never load when transitioning between statuses on the new JSD issue view and using the queue URL (/projects/<pkey>/queues/custom/<queueid>/<issuekey>).

h3. Environment

* New JSD view and accessing the ticket directly through the queue (/projects/<pkey>/queues/custom/<queueid>/<issuekey>).

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Create a screen with the attachment field;
# Associate the screen with a transition;
# Access the ticket and try to transition.

h3. Expected results

The screen loads and the ticket can be transitioned.

h3. Actual result

The loading circle keeps spinning and the screen never loads.

h3. Notes

* The bug only occurs in the queue URL (/projects/<pkey>/queues/custom/<queueid>/<issuekey>) and using the new JSD issue view.
* The error "Uncaught TypeError: JIRA.Templates.DnDAttachmentPlugin[o] is not a function" can be found in the console:
 !Screen Shot 2019-03-07 at 11.38.53.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Only one of the four is necessary:
# Use the browse URL (/browse/<issuekey>); *recommended*
# Use the old view;
# Remove the attachment field from the screen;
# Disable the new JSD issue view.
fields.summary: Screens don't load when transitioning between statuses on the new JSD issue view

fields.description:
When you use the search function in the new portal, "SEND A REQUEST ABOUT" text is shown above the list of suggestions.
This may make the user confused because it can be read that if they click those suggestions, a request will be sent right away.
It'll be great if user could choose to show/hide or modify the texts of this label.
fields.summary: Ability to hide "SEND A REQUEST ABOUT" from the new portal

fields.description: Service Desk  should expose a public API for request feed back comment.
fields.summary: JSD Public API should expose CSAT comment

fields.description: As a customer searching for a request on the Requests page (/servicedesk/customer/user/requests), I would like to enter just the issue number and not the full key to get the results.
fields.summary: Search issues via portal Requests page using only issue number and not full key

fields.description:
*Current behavior:*

When an organization is deleted, if its customers were invited from within the organization, they will be removed from the project.

*Suggestion:*

An easy way to move customers out of organizations without having to reinvite them or the ability to choose if the customers should be deleted or not when deleting an organization.

*Possible workaround:*

Adding the customers to the project with the role Service Desk Customers before deleting the organization will prevent them from getting deleted.
fields.summary: Ability to move a customer out of an organization

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When performing a Jira import which contains Jira Service Desk projects, the import has a chance of randomly failing if the backup file contains a large number (5000+) of portal-only customers. This affects both:
# Jira Server to Jira Cloud
# Jira Cloud to Jira Cloud

The import will fail at the 90% mark of the import process, where user-based operations are performed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Generate a Jira backup
# Restore it into the Jira Cloud instance using the *Restore System* option

h3. Expected Results
Import completes successfully.

h3. Actual Results
Import fails with this stacktrace in the logs:
{code}
Could not add user sample-user@sample-domain.com

com.atlassian.crowd.exception.runtime.OperationFailedException: Failed to import user remotely
at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.CrowdServiceImpl.importUser(CrowdServiceImpl.java:485)
at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.DelegatingCrowdService.importUser(DelegatingCrowdService.java:172)
at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.FilteredCrowdServiceImpl.importUser(FilteredCrowdServiceImpl.java:52)
at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.UsersAndGroupsImportHelper.createNewLocalServiceDeskUser(UsersAndGroupsImportHelper.java:351)
at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.UsersAndGroupsImportHelper.transferUsersToCrowd(UsersAndGroupsImportHelper.java:291)
at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.UsersAndGroupsImportHelper.transferUsersToCrowd(UsersAndGroupsImportHelper.java:238)
at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.IdentityImportHelper.performMigration(IdentityImportHelper.java:135)
at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.CloudImportTaskRunner.performTasksOnImportDb(CloudImportTaskRunner.java:397)
at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.CloudImportTaskRunner.performTasksOnImportDb(CloudImportTaskRunner.java:485)
at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.CloudImportTaskRunner.lambda$null$1(CloudImportTaskRunner.java:223)
at com.atlassian.connpool.impl.AbstractConnectionPoolProvider.withPrivatePool(AbstractConnectionPoolProvider.java:133)
at com.atlassian.jira.connpool.JiraViburConnectionPoolProvider.withPrivatePool(JiraViburConnectionPoolProvider.java:137)
at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.AbstractBackupTaskRunner.lambda$null$0(AbstractBackupTaskRunner.java:63)
at java.util.Optional.map(Optional.java:215)
at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.AbstractBackupTaskRunner.lambda$runWithSeparateContextAsync$1(AbstractBackupTaskRunner.java:62)
at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture$AsyncSupply.run(CompletableFuture.java:1590)
at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)

Caused by: com.atlassian.crowd.exception.OperationFailedException: Service Unavailable
at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.customeraccount.CustomerAccountRemoteDirectoryImpl.importUserInCustomerAccountDirectoryV2(CustomerAccountRemoteDirectoryImpl.java:222)
at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.customeraccount.CustomerAccountRemoteDirectoryImpl.importUser(CustomerAccountRemoteDirectoryImpl.java:204)
at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory.importLocalServiceDeskUserIntoCustomerAccountDirectory(DbCachingRemoteDirectory.java:1142)
at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory.importLocalServiceDeskUserInDirectoryOnlyMode(DbCachingRemoteDirectory.java:1095)
at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory.importLocalServiceDeskUserInDualMode(DbCachingRemoteDirectory.java:1070)
at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory.importLocalServiceDeskUser(DbCachingRemoteDirectory.java:1011)
{code}

h3. Notes
- When retrying the import without making any changes, the import might fail at a different (random) user.

h3. Workaround
- As the behavior of this bug is intermittent, retry the import.
fields.summary: Jira Import fails when importing large number of portal-only customers

fields.description:
*Summary*
Jira Service Desk is "mis-translating" star symbols from the old issue view to hearts

*Steps to Reproduce*
Add a star symbol to a description or comment on the old issue view, then change to the new issue view

*Expected Results*
Star symbol should remain as a star

*Actual Results*
Star symbol changes to a heart

||Old View||New View||
| !old.png|thumbnail! | !new.png|thumbnail! |
*Workaround*
Use the old issue view
fields.summary: Jira Service Desk is "mis-translating" star symbols from the old issue view to hearts

fields.description:
Eventually, automation rules might create a "race condition" with other features, such as connect plugins.

Having the ability to delay automation would be useful for preventing such scenarios.
fields.summary: Ability to delay automation rule executions

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

On an instance with a connect add-on that uses the portal header:

1. Go to a request create page, say /portal/group/123/create/1
2. Pick another request type in the group
3. Wait for everything to load
4. Pick the first request type again
5. The connect add-on is missing

You can navigate to any request type that has already been loaded and the connect-addon would be missing.

Workaround:
Refresh the page
fields.summary: Connect add-ons stop showing up when navigating between portal forms

fields.description:
h3. Suggested resolution
1. Have the ability to set the URL like <Project name>.<instance_name>.atlassian.net, instead of only <instance_name>.atlassian.net. The URL would directly lead the agents to the project.
2. Support project level mail IDs rather than the instance.
fields.summary: Ability to have URL and Mail ID per project rather than instance

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Statement*
It is difficult to know the Service Desk Agents works on which projects.

h3. *Suggestions*
Provide a feature to identify which project each Service Desk Agents were working on/Assigned to.
fields.summary: Generate list of Agents who work on which JIRA Service Desk Projects

fields.description:
*Summary*
 For anonymous portal with the Customer Permissions set for "Who can customers share requests with?' as 'Any customer in the project, by manually entering an email address.' . A user cannot enter an email to any user picker fields.

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Setup the project with the following permissions;
 !image-2019-03-04-15-16-27-453.png|thumbnail!
 # Use the portal as an anonymous user and goto a request create form with a user picker on it
 # Enter the email address in the user picker. No option shows to add the email address to the user picker.

*Expected Results*
 * Customer can enter an email address in a user picker field on request create form. !Screen Shot 2019-03-04 at 3.22.50 pm.png|thumbnail!

*Actual Results*
 * Customer can not enter an email address into a user picker field in request create form. !image-2019-03-04-15-23-31-443.png|thumbnail!

*Workaround*
 * None
fields.summary: Anonymous Portal - User cant enter email address into user picker

fields.description:
*Summary*
 When a new customer is created, their prefered language is set to use the browser's language, but customers notifications are ignoring this setting and defaulting to English if available (*even if it isn't the project's default language*).

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Create a new Service Desk project;
 # Set it's default language to Portuguese (Brazil), but leave English as an option;
 # Create a new customer, it's preferred language will be their browser's language;
 # Using a browser in Portuguese, log in to the portal and create a new request

*Expected Results*
 * Customer notification will be sent in Portuguese

*Actual Results*
 * Customer notification ignores browser language and defaults to English

*Workaround*
 * Have the customer change their prefered language to Portuguese (or other languages)
fields.summary: Customer notifications are not using the customer's browser language and defaults to English (if available)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Missing German/Deutsch translations on service desk portal 

h3. Environment
Default language, Project, indexing language, browser, all of these are set to German, but in the portal some parts of it are not translated. 
Specifically:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
"Requests", "All", "Created by me"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change the Default Language to German
# Change the project's Language to German
# Access a service desk project's portal

h3. Expected Results

The whole portal should be translated.

h3. Actual Results
Some parts not translated: !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 



h3.Workaround
Non
fields.summary: German/Deutsch missing translation in Jira Service Desk portal

fields.description:
h3.*Problem Definition*
On the new Service Desk Portal, it is not possible to search other users when creating tickets on behalf, you can only see a maximum of at least 10 users. Greater than that, you won't be able to search other users to create their request on behalf.

{panel:title=Reproducing the Problem|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
 - Go to your Service Desk Portal e.g. https://<your-domain>.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/2/group/3/create/19
- On the Raise this request on behalf of* field
- Try to change your user to another user
- notice that you will be unable to type in to search other users.
- Instead only a drop down of 10 users value is displayed.
{panel}

h3.*Expected Result*
* A input field should be available, where the user can search other users to select as the reporter when creating n behalf.

h3.*Actual Result*
* No input field is available, the field is not editable, rather when clicked on, a select drop down list is display with a maximum of 10 values of users.
 !portal.png|thumbnail! 


h3.*Workaround*
* Please start typing to search for users when your cursor is blinking to begin
fields.summary: Unable to type in to search other users to create request on behalf in the new Service Desk Portal

fields.description:
h2. Summary

The User is not able to fully print Portal page on IE and MS edge. Only half of the page content being displayed for printing.

h3. Steps to replicate

# Go to Service desk portal
# On the page, right click on mouse and choose print

h3. Observed behavior

Only half of the page being displayed to be printed.

h3. Expected behavior

Able to full print the page
fields.summary: Not able to fully print Portal page on all browers

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If you have a large amount of custom reports it would be beneficial to be able to drag and drop to re-order them as currently they stay in the order they are created.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow reports to be dragged and dropped like the Queues behave

h3. Workaround
No known workaround
fields.summary: Allow reordering of custom reports

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When setting up an alert in the automation, JIRA would mention the user on the comment and this would trigger a notification to be sent out to the mentioned user.

h3. Suggested Solution and Why this is important
For business critical tickets, users would need to be notified while using the application. They need a quicker notification. Email can sometimes be missed. So Service Desk would also need to be able to send an in-app notification (the bell icon) to the mentioned user

h3. Workaround 
Set up a webhook to your Chat channel like Slack so you can be notified through your Chat channel.
fields.summary: Allow alert in automation to trigger the in-app notification

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Jira Service Desk does not send a notification to agents, admins or site-admins when the mail handler stops working and tickets are not generated in Jira or when a failure in the processing log and in the connectivity log happens.

h3. Suggested Resolution
Add the ability to configure a notification to agents, admins or site-admins when Jira Service Desk mail handler stops working or when there is a failure in the incoming logs.

h3. Workaround
Check the incoming email logs in https://<instancename>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/SDMailInfo.jspa for failures.

There are two tabs:
* *The connectivity log tab* is for connection between Jira and the Mail Server.
* *The processing log tab* is for incoming email requests that customers send.
fields.summary: JSD should send a notification when mail handler stop working

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, any customers can be added to any organization.
h3. Suggested Solution
Display a pop up if an agent tries to add a customer with a different domain to an organization where the domain is different.
fields.summary: Display a pop up message if agents try to add a customer with a different domain to an organization

fields.description:
Currently, it is not possible to determine when an email failed to process unless you check the mail audit log for the Service Desk project. (https://<instance.atlassian.net>/secure/admin/SDMailInfo.jspa). This should also include the event notifications when the Jira service desk email handler detects connection or authentication problems.

Please provide an option to notify via the Service Desk team whenever a failure is reported on the log.
fields.summary: Notify the Service Desk Team when Mail Audit log detects failures

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When adding the labels field to the request type of a public portal, the field is not shown on the portal when trying to create a ticket anonymously.

h3. Suggested Resolution
Make the labels field available when accessing the portal anonymously.
fields.summary: Labels field do not show on public portals

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion
It would be nice to have the option to enable CAPTCHA for JIRA Service Desk Widget as so far that it's not customizable.
fields.summary: Enable CAPTCHA for JIRA Service Desk Widget

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When viewing articles from the widget the interface is too small and the article does not look good.

h3. Suggested Resolution
Have the ability to choose if the article will open on the widget or the portal.
fields.summary: Open widget articles in the portal

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition

To export search result to CSV, Word, and XML, there's no way to exclude fields with considering visibility such as internal comments.
h2. Suggested Solution

Provide a feature to select visibility for example "Export CSV as Customer".
fields.summary: Export search results with considering visibility

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The "Share with" option is always the last field in the Raise a request page. Since it is common for optional fields are ordered at the bottom, customers always miss selecting the correct organization they need to share the ticket with.
h3. Suggested Solution
Introduce the ability to move the option to the top of the page.
h3. Why this is important
Customers could easily miss selecting the correct organization they want to share the request with since the option is located at the bottom of the page.
fields.summary: Ability to move the "Share with" field location to the top of the page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It would be beneficial to include extra column choices for use in the issue navigator and filters for greater SLA visibility

h3. Suggested Solution
Include the following columns:
* Time elapsed - as opposed to a count down to breach, how long has the SLA been running
* Goal - Include the SLA goal ie; 40h so at a glance you can see

h3. Workaround
No known workaround
fields.summary: Add more SLA columns for use in issue nav / filters / queues

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Request type with Issue type not configured in the Issue type schemes cannot be deleted

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a request type with eg *IT Help* issue type
# Remove the issue type from the issue type scheme for the project
# Delete the request type

h3. Expected Results
Request type deleted
h3. Actual Results
Delete request type windows appear. Clicking on delete shows a loading icon but does nothing. Nothing in logs

h3.Workaround
Add the issue type to the issue type scheme and remove the request type. Remove the issue type from the scheme again.
fields.summary: Request type with Issue type not configured in the Issue type schemes cannot be deleted

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JSD Issue Type avatars missing from choices. Specifically Change and Problem, requiring the customers to manually save the icons to file and re-upload for use each time.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create then edit, or edit an existing issue type
# Attempt to choose the icon for problem or change, notice they're not available.

h3. Expected Results
With a valid JSD subscription all issue type icons should be available to choose.

h3. Actual Results
Problem and Change are are missing


h3.Workaround
It is possible to save the icons by right clicking on the existing issue type and saving image to file, or open image in new tab then save.
fields.summary: JSD Issue Type avatars missing from choices

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a request is raised in an anonymous portal, the ticket would not be shared although the customer who raised belongs to an organization.
h3. Suggested Solution
Introduce a configuration to allow sharing requests with organization members when ticket is created anonymously by a known user.
fields.summary: The ability to share request with organization member when created in anonymous portal

fields.description:
Hey there,

At the moment queues in JSD (Jira Service Desk) are using "infinite" scrolling of issues.

As a result, sometimes it is hard to get to the right issue.
Suggestion is to have certain custom URLs that could be used to "jump" to a certain page of JSD queue.

For example, if we want to jump to a 3rd page of JSD queue (50 issues per page) - we would use:
https://<instance_name>.atlassian.net/projects/ER/queues/custom/8/page/3
fields.summary: JSD queues pagination - implement URLs that could be used to jump to a certain page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It would be useful to be able to change the reply line marker in cases where the customers mail clients don't accept UTF-8 causing the entire email thread to be attached to the ticket every comment


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Send a customer notificaiton to a customer who's mail client does not accept UTF-8


h3. Expected Results
Proper cut line: -------

h3. Actual Results
Their Cutline: â"-â"-â"-â"
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
No known workaround
fields.summary: Ability to edit the reply line marker characters

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Portal Requests menu and the breadcrumb is missing German translation

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure German language pack is installed - in this case it's default
# Set your customer profile to German 
# Notice the requests menu does not translate nor does the breadcrumbs

h3. Expected Results
The menu is translated to German

h3. Actual Results
The menu is not translated
 
h3. Notes
* Also tried with browser language configured to German
* Set Jira, project, profile and browser to German
* Seems to work in Dutch, must be language specific


h3.Workaround
No known workaround
fields.summary: Portal Requests menu and breadcrumb is missing German translation

fields.description:
h3. The Issue
Currently, if a customer wants to find content in JSD cloud, they need to search for specific keywords, in order to find the required content.

This forces administrators to set up the portal in a way that the customers may know what to look for, even though this is not always feasible depending on the amount of KBs there are on a certain project/space. 

h3. The suggestion
Provide a "Space overview" of the KBs that are available for a given project, instead of just the search bar for Customers. This would help not only the administrators but the customers themselves to find the content.
fields.summary: Provide a space overview for customers when searching for KBs

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a service desk portal sets a date field in the portal.
There are no apparent/visible way to clear a date picker field if they wish for a correction or not an input.

The only way to do so is by going to the field directly , and type backspace.
Even then, when clicking on the field, the cursor is at the beginning of the date rather than at the end and there is no way to move that.

This would confuse customer and will never thought of hitting the backspace button since the cursor is on the begininng of the date.

h3. Notes
The request would be to ensure that when a date is picked. the cursor is at the end of the date rather than at the beginning to avoid the confusion

h3.Workaround
Click on the date field, hit backspace to clear dates
fields.summary: Clear date field requires to Hit on backspace and confusing since cursor is at beginning of date

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Some automation rules are being triggered with delay

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an automation rule that triggers on "Issue Create".
# Create a ticket to trigger the automation.

h3. Expected Results

The automation is triggered immediately.

h3. Actual Results

The automation will be delayed by a few minutes.

h3. Notes
The issue is intermittent.

h3.Workaround
None at the moment.
fields.summary: Automation rules may execute only after a delay

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

When using the queue, there is a need for an easy way to filter tickets, for example, by organization or reporter. Instead of editing the entire queue filter to achieve this. 

h3. Proposed Solution

As a possibily to filter by column/field values in a queue's columns:  !image-2019-02-13-23-24-50-217.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Filtering in queue

fields.description:
This feature is to request the ability to add the 'time' value to the Created field in JSD Queues. 

Here is a screenshot of what it currently looks like and what would great to have:
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Notes:
Hovering over the field currently shows the time.
fields.summary: Add 'time' to Created column in Service Desk Queues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-5032].
  {panel}
h3. Problem Definition
Many Service Desk environments often handle a variety of Asset/HR request via Service Desk. There is a lot of tedium in micromanaging these task. 

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have Automation in conjunction with the Approval process stream line the approval process. Similar to the functionality in [JIRA Checklist| https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1211562/checklist-for-jira?hosting=cloud&tab=overview]. That allows a checklist of subtask to be managed by the agents/managers and update the parent task to notify the customer.
fields.summary: Allow sub-tasks to be created via JSD automation

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to send a request with an attachment using the service desk widget in Internet Explorer 11. It reports the following error "An unknown Error occurred. Please try again later" 
 It works fine in other supported browsers.
 !Widget.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Create a Widget with attachment as an optional field
 Load the widget in Internet Explorer version 11
 Try to send a request with an attachment
h3. Expected Results

A request is sent successfully and a ticket is created in the service desk project
h3. Actual Results

It reports the following error "An unknown Error occurred. Please try again later"
h3. Notes

Able to send the request when no attachment is provided.
h3. Workaround

Use any other [Supported Browser|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/supported-browsers-744721663.html]
fields.summary: Unable to send a request with an attachment using the service desk widget in Internet Explorer 11

fields.description:
More context here:
[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Service-Desk-questions/Service-Desk-Customers-quick-query-links/qaq-p/1003353]

In a nutshell, the user wants to be able to see all the opened/closed tickets by a customer in an organization.
Today there is only the option to see all tickets open/closed in the organization or by a customer. Not by both.
fields.summary: Clicking on closed/opened tickets link inside organization shows all closed tickets by a customer and not just the ones from the organization

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Service Desk Customers (both portal only and AA) whose user_name is different from the user_key on the app_user table, are unable to add Request Participants via email (Cc).

h3. Environment required
* A Service Desk project with an email channel configured.
* A user that had their username changed. (It used to be possible via the instance's admin panel)

Although [usernames can no longer be changed|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2018/06/say-goodbye-to-usernames-in-atlassian-cloud], they still exist in the backend and are referenced by some functionalities of the application.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Atlassian Account customer.  
# Change the account's username (contact the Atlassian Support to have that done)
# Have the user send an email to the Jira Service Desk handler, Cc'ing any other user.

h3. Expected Results

- The issue is successfully created.
- The CC is added as a Request Participant of the ticket.
- No errors are displayed in the log.

h3. Actual Results
- The following error is displayed in the Handler's processing log: {code}Mail handler throws exception: Unexpected error while running action as user 'xxxx' {code}
- Despite the error, the ticket is successfully created.
- No Request Participant is added to the ticket.
 
h3. Notes
This also affects comments done via email.

h3.Workaround
- Log in the portal and add the other customer as Request Participant.
fields.summary: Renamed users are unable to add Request Participants via email

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, the permission to add agents to a project is restricted to the administrators. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability for users to add agents without having administrators permission
h3. Why this is important
This ability would allow the administrative tasks to be distributed to dedicated users.
fields.summary: Ability to add agents to project without admin permissions

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Help Center has a large amount of whitespace when a customer has access to only one portal. You can see a flicker of an app loading then disappearing in the whitespace. It seems where the Portal cards would normally 'live' does not shrink when it does not have any to display.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Give a customer access to only one portal
# Visit the Help Center /servicedesk/customer/portals
# It no longer redirects to the individual portal URL until the next screen but still seems to show the individual portal
# Notice the large amount of whitespace where the Portal cards would normally sit if you had access to multiple portals

h3. Expected Results
With access to only one portal, the space where you choose the portal to access should minimise.

h3. Actual Results
The space where you choose which portal to use seems to show full height of a single row of portal choices even though they do not exist.
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
No known workaround.
fields.summary: With access to only one portal, the space for portal selection does not minimise.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a Help Center logo is set the portal signup verification pages form does not adjust and the submit button is hidden which requires the form to be scrolled for it to be visible

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Invite a customer from a JSD project
# Click on the invitiation email
# Notice on the form to enter your name and password, the submit button is not visible

h3. Expected Results
The form should not render the logo and the submit button is visible without scrolling.

h3. Actual Results
Only the name and password fields are visble, the customer must scroll to realise the submit button is there.
 
h3. Notes
Only affected when a Help Center logo is set

h3.Workaround
Hitting enter does submit the form. But the current view has the potential to cause confusion for some customers.
fields.summary: Help Center logo should not render on the Portal sign up form from an invite

fields.description:
*Summary*

Creating a "Due Date" hidden field for a Request Type in a Service Desk project while the system language being "German" will lead to customers unable to create requests via the portal. The customer will hit into the "This form contains a hidden field that does not have a valid default value configured" error.

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Go to General Configuration
 # Change Indexing Language to _German_
 # Change Default Language to _Deutsch (Deutschland)_
 # Change Default user time zone to _Europe_ and Timezone to _(GMT+01:00) Berlin_
 # Go to the Service Desk project > Request Type > set "Due Date" as a hidden field 
 # Change the date picker field (e. g Due Date) to any date in December (e.g 4/Dez/32 10:00 PM)


*Expected Results*

- JIRA should be able to recognize "Dez" abbreviation for December
 

*Actual Results*

 !error1.PNG|thumbnail! 
 
*Note*
If the same hidden field is viewed from a English profile in the instance it will show the following:

 !error2.PNG|thumbnail! 

It will look correct in one language profile and show an error in another, the same goes for the Customer Portal, depending on which language: 

- If the system is set to German, the date will be set to 2/Dez/29, the English profile customers will not be able to create tickets. Because Jira is expecting the input to be 2/Dec/29
- If the language profile is switched to English and the due date is set to 2/Dec/29, the German profile customers will not be able to create tickets. Because Jira is expecting the input to be 2/Dez/29


*Workaround 1*

Change the due date to a month which is both acceptable in English and German, such as 4/Nov/20, the value "Nov" is accepted in both languages. 


*Workaround 2:*

From within JIRA, change the date format from 02/Dez/29 to 02.12.29.  

# Navigate to *General Configurations* > click on "Advanced Settings":

Update your settings so that they match what is shown below:
# *jira.date.picker.javascript.format=%d.%m.%y*
# *jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format=%d.%m.%y %H:%M*
# *jira.date.time.picker.java.format=d.MM.yy H:mm*
# *jira.date.picker.java.format=d.MM.yy*
fields.summary: Setting Due Date with German Language results in portal requests failed to be created.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Project settings option redirects users to the queue when you have browse project permissions

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a brand new project.
# Then go to JIRA Dashboard > Projects 
{noformat}
https://instance_URL.atlassian.net/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa
{noformat}
# Click on ( ... ) > Project Settings

h3. Expected Results
You should be redirected to the project settings.

h3. Actual Results
If you have browse project permissions, you are redirected to the queues instead.
 
h3. Notes
If you don't have browse project permissions, then you are redirected to the project settings appropriately. 

h3. Workaround
Access the project settings directly from the project sidebar.
 !Screen Shot 2019-02-12 at 18.06.04.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Project settings option redirects users to the queue when you have browse project permissions

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When viewing a Jira Service Desk ticket from a board (kanban or scrum) and utilizing the new issue view, it is not possible to select if the comment is internal or shared with the customer.
 !Screen Shot 2019-02-05 at 17.44.22.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Resolution
Have the ability to select if the comment will be internal or shared with the customer from the board (kanban or scrum) new issue view.

h3. Workaround
Access the ticket directly from the Service Desk view.
fields.summary: Have the ability to choose if the comment will be internal or shared with the customer from the board new issue view

fields.description:
*Update from Atlassian Team 07/03/21*
 Hey all, I have disappointing news for all of you. This work has been paused in order to focus on performance improvements and other accessibility initiatives. We still believe this is still highly important work and we understand the impact this is having on some of our customers. Unfortunately we do not have an estimate on when it will resume. This is a hard update to make as it comes after the 4 year anniversary of this ticket; nonetheless, we want to ensure that all of you are informed.

This change in direction has been made centrally in our Design System which will lead to improvements across many properties, but in the meantime it affects Jira’s ability to roll out dark mode directly. That doesn’t remove the sting of this for those of us who are passionate about dark mode, but know that the decision from our leaders was made with the customer in mind. When Design System has capacity to pick this up again, myself or whoever owns the work at the time will update all of you - Jake


*Suggestion:* Suggesting a simple, built-in dark theme that can be enabled from Settings. Simple colour scheme change to make it easier on the eyes.
fields.summary: Native Dark Theme
